Description: Fragment (possibly furnishing) of undyed, plain weave linen a) main cloth: decorated with a line of embroidery in green, red, pink, blue and yellow wool, and with an applied tapestry motif (b) embroidery, chain stitch, shows a stylised garland with rosettes and leaves (ending in a bud seen from the side, self-bands in linen). Warp: S-spin, c.33-35 tpc. Weft: S-spin, c.14 tpc; Edges: one plain selvedge, other edges fragmentary; Sewing: no constructional sewing, embroidery yarn Z-spin S-ply all colours. b) small, tapestry-weave motif: stylised basket filled with fruit, in purple, red, blue, yellow and green wool and undyed linen. Attached to a) by sewing. Tapestry weave on grouped warp threads; diagonal float brocading; Warp: linen, S-spin, c.15 pairs per cm; Weft: wool Z-spin, linen S-spin, c.45 tpc; Edges all hidden; Sewing: overcasting in S-spin Z-ply sewing thread.
Condition: 16a Good; 16b Fair, float brocading worn away. At unknown date was stuck to sticky net.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
